raw: * Objects which are used as delegates for the qx.ui.list.List may
* implement any of the methods described in this interface. The delegate does
* not need to implement all the methods of this interface. If a method is not
* implemented the qx.ui.list.List provides a default
* implementation.
* Note: This interface is meant to document the delegate but should not be
* listed in the implement key of a class unless all methods are
* actually implemented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Objects which are used as delegates for the qx.ui.list.List may implement any of the methods described in this interface. The delegate does not need to implement all the methods of this interface. If a method is not implemented the qx.ui.list.List provides a default implementation. Note: This interface is meant to document the delegate but should not be listed in the implement key of a class unless all methods are actually implemented.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties
* on the item widget cells created by the controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Item to modify.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties on the item widget cells created by the controller.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties
* on the group widget cells created by the controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Group to modify.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties on the group widget cells created by the controller.

raw: * Creates an item cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to
* implement the {@link #bindItem} function as well to get the needed
* properties bound.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget} A new created item cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates an item cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to implement the {@link #bindItem} function as well to get the needed properties bound.

raw: * Creates a group cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to
* implement the {@link #bindGroupItem} function as well to get the needed
* properties bound.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget} A new created item cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a group cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to implement the {@link #bindGroupItem} function as well to get the needed properties bound.

raw: * Sets up the binding for the given item and index.
* For every property you want to bind, use
* {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this:
* <code>
* controller.bindProperty("path.in.the.model", "label", options, item, id);
*
* @param controller {qx.ui.list.core.MWidgetController} The currently used controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used item.
* @param id {Integer} The id for the binding.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets up the binding for the given item and index. For every property you want to bind, use {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this: controller.bindProperty("path.in.the.model", "label", options, item, id);

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {Integer} The id for the binding.

raw: * Sets up the binding for the given group item and index.
* For every property you want to bind, use
* {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this:
* <code>
* controller.bindProperty(null, "value", options, item, id);
*
* @param controller {qx.ui.list.core.MWidgetController} The currently used controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used group item.
* @param id {Integer} The id for the binding.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets up the binding for the given group item and index. For every property you want to bind, use {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this: controller.bindProperty(null, "value", options, item, id);

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used group item.
@param.description: The created and used group item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {Integer} The id for the binding.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to filter the model. The filter
* method has to return true if the given data should be
* shown and false if the given data should be ignored.
* @param data {var} The data to be checked.
* @return {Boolean} true if the data passes the filter,
* false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to filter the model. The filter method has to return true if the given data should be shown and false if the given data should be ignored.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} The data to be checked.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the data passes the filter, false otherwise.
@return.description: true if the data passes the filter, false otherwise.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to sort the model. The sorting method
* should return a negative value if a < b, zero if a = b, or a positive
* value if a > b.
* @param a {var} value to compare.
* @param b {var} value to compare.
* @return {Integer} should return a negative value if a < b, zero
*   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to sort the model. The sorting method should return a negative value if a < b, zero if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer} should return a negative value if a < b, zero
   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.
@return.description:
should return a negative value if a < b, zero
   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to group the model. The group method
* should return unique identifier for the passed data.
* Note: When you returning null the passed data will added
* to the default group, which is ??? from the type
* String. But keep in mind that you can only use the default
* group feature when each other group identifier is also a String.
* Otherwise an exception occurs, because you can't mix Object
* and String group identifiers.
* @param data {var} The data to be checked.
* @return {String|Object|null} The group identifier for the data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to group the model. The group method should return unique identifier for the passed data. Note: When you returning null the passed data will added to the default group, which is ??? from the type String. But keep in mind that you can only use the default group feature when each other group identifier is also a String. Otherwise an exception occurs, because you can't mix Object and String group identifiers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} The data to be checked.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|Object|null} The group identifier for the data.
@return.description: The group identifier for the data.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to reset properties or states.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Item to modify.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to reset properties or states.
